metatags.og:title: World War II Photos
metatags.og:description: Enlarge General Douglas MacArthur wades ashore during initial landings at Leyte, Philippine Islands. Local Identifier: 111-SC-407101, National Archives Identifier: 531424. View in National Archives Catalog The Second World War was documented on a huge scale by thousands of photographers and artists who created millions of pictures. American military photographers representing all of the armed services covered the battlefronts around the world. Every activity of the war was depicted--training, combat, support services, and much more.

metatags.og:description: Haunting images of Auschwitz prisoners taken as they entered the camp have been rendered in colour in time for the 75th anniversary of the liberation of the Nazi death camp by Soviet troops.
metatags.mol:headline: Escape from Auschwitz: Prisoner who managed to flee the Nazi death camp is seen alongside fellow inmates in newly-colourised images released to mark 75th anniversary of the prison's liberation
metatags.author: Chris Pleasance
metatags.article:author: https://www.facebook.com/DailyMail

videoobject.name: Survivor recalls time in Nazi death camp as he walks through it
videoobject.description: This footage shows a German Nazi camp survivor recalling his time as a prisoner. He walks through the Auschwitz-Birkenau Memorial and Museum in Poland as he tells his story.
